Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: “We had a job fair in the middle of a heat wave and there was still a line going out of the door,”

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The U.S. Army was making 14,000 artillery shells a month prior to the conflict. Now, officials at the plant told Morning Edition that the army is producing 36,000 shells a month, up from 24,000 just six months ago.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Tobyhanna Army Depot, which specializes in logistics support and radar equipment for foreign allies such as Ukraine, estimates that the company has a $2.4 billion dollar impact on the area and that it is the largest industrial employer in the region.
